snippet: Pranksters have been filing false reports of breaking horrific crimes at celebrities’ homes in Southern California, designed to provoke the dispatch of SWAT teams.
abstract: Pranksters are filing false reports of horrific crimes in progress at celebrities’ homes in Los Angeles area in effort to provoke dispatch of SWAT teams; rash of hoaxes has turned into full-blown 'swatting' epidemic, garnering sober concern from police officials and victims alike, and promise of crackdown by city and state lawmakers.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and IAN LOVETT

lead_paragraph: Pranksters have been filing false reports of breaking horrific crimes at celebrities’ homes in Southern California, designed to provoke the dispatch of SWAT teams.

headline.seo: Hollywood ‘Swatting’ Hoax Strains Both Police and Stars
headline.main: ‘Swatting’ Hoax Tests the Police and Stars Alike
headline.print_headline: ‘Swatting’ Hoax Tests the Police And Stars Alike
